title: Harm Advocacy / Normalization (Harm-Directed Language)
description: Flags items that contain harm-directed language (violence, punitive harm, or expulsion/banishment frames) in the item body. This signal measures presence and frequency of harm-language, not intent, not likelihood, and not endorsement.

supports: Identifying items in the dataset where harm-directed language appears (as text).
Quantifying frequency and distribution of harm-language across time and threads.
does_not_support: Inferring intent, motivation, or psychological traits.
Predicting real-world behavior, likelihood of action, or threat level.
Determining endorsement vs. reporting without explicit local evidence in the same item.
failure_modes: News reposts or quoted material can trigger matches without endorsement.
Discussion of harm as a topic (e.g., condemnation, policy debate) can trigger matches.
Euphemisms or slang outside the lexicon may be missed (false negatives).
epistemics.scope_statement: All results are limited to observable content in the collected dataset and declared surfaces for this run.

inclusion_rules.description: Harm-directed language appears in the item body.

exclusion_rules.description: Exclude items where harm is referenced in an explicitly condemning frame (conservative exclusion).

value: (^|[^A-Za-z0-9_])(this is wrong|not ok|stop (doing|saying)|i don\x27?t condone|that\x27?s messed up|shouldn\x27?t)([^A-Za-z0-9_]|$)

metrics.title: Harm-language items
metrics.description: Number of items matching harm-language inclusion criteria after exclusions.

metrics.title: Rate per 100 items
metrics.description: Harm-language count normalized per 100 items in the analyzed scope.

metrics.title: Over-time distribution
metrics.description: Temporal distribution of harm-language items (e.g., monthly bins).
